<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	-&#160;78&#160;-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Royalty/Tax Incentive Volumes for Exploratory Gas Wells Drilled on or after October 1, 2002
</FONT>
	providing reduced Crown royalty and freehold tax rates on incentive volumes of 25,000,000 m
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	3
</FONT>
	for qualifying exploratory gas wells;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Royalty/Tax Incentive Volumes for Horizontal Oil Wells Drilled on or after October 1, 2002
</FONT>
	providing reduced Crown royalty and freehold tax rates on incentive volumes of 6,000 m
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	3
</FONT>
	for non-deep horizontal oil&#160;&#160;wells
	and 16,000 m
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	3
</FONT>
	for deep horizontal oil&#160;&#160;wells (more than 1,700 metres or within certain formations);
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Royalty/Tax Regime for Incremental Oil Produced from New or Expanded Waterflood Projects Implemented on or after October 1, 2002
</FONT>
	treating incremental production from waterflood projects as fourth tier oil for the purposes of royalty calculation;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Royalty/Tax Regime for Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects (Excluding Waterflood Projects) Commencing prior to April 1, 2005
</FONT>
	providing Crown royalty and freehold tax determinations based in part on the profitability of enhanced recovery projects pre- and post-payout; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Royalty/Tax Regime for Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects (Excluding Waterflood Projects) Commencing on or after April 1, 2005
</FONT>
	providing a Crown royalty of 1% of gross revenues on enhanced oil recovery projects pre-payout and 20% post-payout and a freehold production tax of 0% on operating income from
	enhanced oil recovery projects pre-payout and 8% post-payout.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 1975, the Government of Saskatchewan introduced a Royalty Tax Rebate ("
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RTR
</FONT>
	") as a response to the Government of Canada disallowing crown royalties and similar taxes as a deductible business expense for income tax purposes.&#160;&#160;As of January 1, 2007, the remaining balance
	of any unused RTR will be limited in its carry forward to seven years since the Government of Canada's initiative to reintroduce the full deduction of provincial resource royalties from federal and provincial taxable income.&#160;&#160;Saskatchewan's RTR will be wound down as a result of the Government if Canada's plan to reintroduce full deductibility of provincial resource royalties for corporate income tax purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Land Tenure
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Crude oil and natural gas located in the western provinces is owned predominantly by the respective provincial governments.&#160;&#160;Provincial governments grant rights to explore for and produce oil and natural gas pursuant to leases, licences, and permits for varying terms from two years, and on conditions set forth in provincial legislation
	including requirements to perform specific work or make payments.&#160;&#160;Oil and natural gas located in such provinces can also be privately owned and rights to explore for and produce such oil and natural gas are granted by lease on such terms and conditions as may be negotiated.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each of the provinces of Alberta, British Columbia and Saskatchewan has implemented legislation providing for the reversion to the Crown of mineral rights to deep, non-productive geological formations at the conclusion of the primary term of a lease or license.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In Alberta, the NRF includes a policy of "shallow rights reversion" which provides, for the first time in western Canada, for the reversion to the Crown of mineral rights to shallow, non-productive geological formations for all leases and licenses.&#160;&#160;For leases and licenses issued subsequent to January 1, 2009, shallow rights reversion
	will be applied at the conclusion of the primary term of the lease or license.&#160;&#160;Holders of leases or licences that have been continued indefinitely prior to January 1, 2009 will receive a notice regarding the reversion of the shallow rights, which will be implemented three years from the date of the notice.&#160;&#160;The order in which these agreements will receive the reversion notice will depend on their vintage and location, with the older leases and licenses receiving reversion notices first beginning
	in January 2011.&#160;&#160;Leases and licences that were granted prior to January 1, 2009 but continued after that date will not be subject to shallow rights reversion until they reach the end of their primary term and are continued (at which time deep rights reversion will be applied); thereafter, the holders of such agreements will be served with shallow rights reversion notices based on vintage and location similar to leases and licences that were already continued as of January 1, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	-&#160;79&#160;-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="COLOR: BLACK; LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Environmental Regulation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The oil and natural gas industry is currently subject to environmental regulations pursuant to a variety of provincial and federal legislation.&#160;&#160;Such legislation provides for restrictions and prohibitions on the release or emission of various substances produced in association with certain oil and gas industry operations, such
	as sulphur dioxide and nitrous oxide.&#160;&#160;In addition, such legislation requires that well and facility sites be abandoned and reclaimed to the satisfaction of provincial authorities.&#160;&#160;Compliance with such legislation can require significant expenditures and a breach of such requirements may result in suspension or revocation of necessary licenses and authorizations, civil liability for pollution damage, and the imposition of material fines and penalties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December, 2008, the Government of Alberta released a new land use policy for surface land in Alberta, the Alberta Land Use Framework (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	ALUF
</FONT>
	").&#160;&#160;The ALUF sets out an approach to manage public and private land use and natural resource development in a manner that is
	consistent with the long-term economic, environmental and social goals of the province.&#160;&#160;It calls for the development of region-specific land use plans in order to manage the combined impacts of existing and future land use within a specific region and the incorporation of a cumulative effects management approach into such plans.&#160;&#160;&#160;The
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Alberta Land Stewardship Act
</FONT>
	(the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	ALSA
</FONT>
	")
	was proclaimed in force in Alberta on October 1, 2009, providing the legislative authority for the Government of Alberta to implement the policies contained in the ALUF.&#160;&#160;Regional plans established pursuant to the ALSA are deemed to be legislative instruments equivalent to regulations and are binding on the Government of Alberta and provincial regulators, including those governing the oil and gas industry.&#160;&#160;In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between a regional plan and another regulation,
	regulatory instrument or statutory consent, the regional plan will prevail.&#160;&#160;Further, the ALSA requires local governments, provincial departments, agencies and administrative bodies or tribunals to review their regulatory instruments and make any appropriate changes to ensure that they comply with an adopted regional plan.&#160;&#160;The ALSA also contemplates the amendment or extinguishment of previously issued statutory consents such as regulatory permits, licenses, approvals and authorizations in
	order for the purpose of achieving or maintaining an objective or policy resulting from the implementation of a regional plan.&#160;&#160;Among the measures to support the goals of the regional plans contained in the ALSA are conservation easements, which can be granted for the protection, conservation and enhancement of land; and conservation directives, which are explicit declarations contained in a regional plan to set aside specified lands in order to protect, conserve, manage and enhance the environment.&#160;&#160;Although
	no regional plans have been established under the ALSA, the planning process is underway for the Lower Athabasca Region (which contains the majority of oil sands development) and the South Saskatchewan Region.&#160;&#160;While the potential impact of the regional plans established under the ALSA cannot yet be determined, it is clear that such regional plans may have a significant impact on land use in Alberta and may affect the oil and gas industry.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Climate Change Regulation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Federal
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December 2002, the Government of Canada ratified the Kyoto Protocol ("
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Kyoto Protocol
</FONT>
	"), which requires a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by signatory countries between 2008 and 2012.&#160;&#160;The Kyoto Protocol officially came into force on February 16, 2005 and commits
	Canada to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions levels to 6% below 1990 "business-as-usual" levels by 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In anticipation of the expiry of the Kyoto Protocol in 2012, government leaders and representatives from approximately 170 countries met in Copenhagen, Denmark from December 6 to 18, 2009 (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Copenhagen Conference
</FONT>
	") to attempt to negotiate a successor to the Kyoto Protocol.&#160;&#160;The
	primary result of the Copenhagen Conference was the Copenhagen Accord, which represents a broad political consensus rather than a binding international treaty like the Kyoto Protocol and has not been endorsed by all participating countries.&#160;&#160;The Copenhagen Accord reinforces the commitment to reducing GHG emissions contained in the Kyoto Protocol and promises funding to help developing countries mitigate and adapt to climate change.&#160;&#160;Although certain countries, including Canada, have committed
	to reducing their emissions individually or jointly by at least 80% by 2050, the Copenhagen Accord does not establish binding GHG emissions reduction targets.&#160;&#160;The Copenhagen Accord calls for a review and implementation of its stated goals by 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	-&#160;80&#160;-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In response to the Copenhagen Accord, the Government of Canada has recently indicated that it will seek to achieve a 17% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 2005 levels by 2020.&#160;&#160;This goal is similar to the goal expressed in previous policy documents which are discussed below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February 14, 2007, the House of Commons passed Bill C-288,
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	An Act to ensure Canada meets its global climate change obligations under the Kyoto Protocol
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;The resulting
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Kyoto Protocol Implementation Act
</FONT>
	came into
	force on June 22, 2007.&#160;&#160;Its stated purpose is to "ensure that Canada takes effective and timely action to meet its obligations under the Kyoto Protocol and help address the problem of global climate change." It requires the federal Minister of the Environment to, among other things, produce an annual climate change plan detailing the measures to be taken to ensure Canada meets its obligations under the Kyoto Protocol.&#160;&#160;It also authorizes the establishment of regulations respecting matters
	such as emissions limits, monitoring, trading and enforcement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On April 26, 2007, the Government of Canada released "Turning the Corner: An Action Plan to Reduce Greenhouse Gases and Air Pollution" (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Action Plan
</FONT>
	") which set forth a plan for regulations to address both greenhouse gases and air pollution.&#160;&#160;An update to the Action Plan,
	"Turning the Corner: Regulatory Framework for Industrial Greenhouse Gas Emissions" was released on March 10, 2008 (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Updated Action Plan
</FONT>
	").&#160;&#160;Although draft regulations for the implementation of the Updated Action Plan were intended to be published in the fall of 2008 and become binding on January 1, 2010, no such regulations have been proposed to date.&#160;&#160;Further, representatives the Government of Canada have recently indicated that
	the proposals contained in the Updated Action Plan will be modified to ensure consistency with the direction ultimately taken by the United States with respect to greenhouse gas emissions regulation.&#160;&#160;The approach of the Unites States is expected to include an absolute cap on emissions combined with allowances to be used for compliance that may be partially auctioned off to regulated entities.&#160;&#160;It is also unclear whether the approach adopted by the United States will provide for the payment
	into a technology fund as a compliance mechanism, as is currently permitted in Alberta and by the Updated Action Plan.&#160;&#160;As a result, many provisions of the Updated Action Plan, described below, are expected to be significantly modified.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The stated goal of the Updated Action Plan, as currently drafted, is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to 20% below 2006 levels by 2020 and 60-70% by 2050.&#160;&#160;As noted above, the goal has now been modified by the Government of Canada.&#160;&#160;The Updated Action Plan outlines emissions intensity-based targets which will be applied
	to regulated sectors on either a facility-specific, sector-wide or company-by-company basis.&#160;&#160;Facility-specific targets applied to the upstream oil and gas, oil sands, petroleum refining and natural gas pipelines sectors.&#160;&#160;Unless a minimum regulatory threshold applies, all facilities within a regulated sector will be subject to the emissions intensity targets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Updated Action Plan makes a distinction between "Existing Facilities" and "New Facilities".&#160;&#160;For Existing Facilities, the Updated Action Plan requires an emissions intensity reduction of 18% below 2006 levels by 2010 followed by a continuous annual emissions intensity improvement of 2%.&#160;&#160;"New Facilities" are defined
	as facilities beginning operations in 2004 and include both greenfield facilities and major facility expansions that (i) result in a 25% or greater increase in a facility's physical capacity, or (ii) involve significant changes to the processes of the facility.&#160;&#160;New Facilities will be given a 3-year grace period during which no emissions intensity reductions will be required.&#160;&#160;Targets requiring an annual 2% emissions intensity reduction will begin to apply in the fourth year of commercial
	operation of a New Facility.&#160;&#160;Further, emissions intensity targets for New Facilities will be based on a cleaner fuel standard to encourage continuous emissions intensity reductions over time.&#160;&#160;The method of applying this cleaner fuel standard has not yet been determined.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Updated Action Plan indicates that targets for the adoption of carbon capture and storage ("
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CCS
</FONT>
	") technologies will be developed for oil
	sands in-situ facilities, upgraders and coal-fired power generators that begin operations in 2012 or later.&#160;&#160;These targets will become operational in 2018, although the exact nature of the targets has not yet been determined.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Given the large number of small facilities within the upstream oil and gas and natural gas pipeline sectors, facilities within these sectors will only be subject to emissions intensity targets if they meet certain minimum emissions thresholds.&#160;&#160;That threshold will be (i) 50,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalents per facility
	per year
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	for the upstream oil and gas facility; and (iii)&#160;10,000 boe/d/company.&#160;These regulatory thresholds are significantly lower than the regulatory threshold in force in Alberta, discussed below.&#160;&#160;In all other sectors governed by the Updated Action Plan, all facilities will be subject to regulation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage90"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	-&#160;81&#160;-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Four separate compliance mechanisms are provided for in the Updated Action Plan in respect of the above targets: Technology Fund contributions, offset credits, clean development credits and credits for early action.&#160;&#160;Regulated entities will be able to use Technology Fund contributions to meet their emissions intensity targets.&#160;&#160;The
	contribution rate for Technology Fund contributions will increase over time, beginning at $15 tonnes per CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalent for the 2010-12 period, rising to $20 in 2013, and thereafter increasing at the nominal rate of GDP growth.&#160;&#160;Maximum contribution limits will also decline from 70% in 2010 to 0% in 2018.&#160;&#160;Monies raised through contributions to the Technology Fund will be used to invest in technology to reduce greenhouse
	gas emissions.&#160;&#160;Alternatively, regulated entities may be able to receive credits for investing in large-scale and transformative projects at the same contribution rate and under similar requirements as described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The offset system is intended to encourage emissions reductions from activities outside of the regulated sphere, allowing non-regulated entities to participate in and benefit from emissions reduction activities.&#160;&#160;In order to generate offset credits, project proponents must propose and receive approval for emissions reduction activities
	that will be verified before offset credits will be issued to the project proponent.&#160;&#160;Those credits can then be sold to regulated entities for use in compliance or non-regulated purchasers that wish to either purchase the offset credits for cancellation or banking for future use or sale.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Updated Action Plan, regulated entities will also be able to purchase credits created through the Clean Development Mechanism of the Kyoto Protocol which facilitates investment by developed nations in emissions-reduction projects in developing countries.&#160;&#160;The purchase of such Emissions Reduction Credits will be restricted
	to 10% of each firm's regulatory obligation, with the added restriction that credits generated through forest sink projects will not be available for use in complying with the Canadian regulations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Finally, a one-time credit of up to 15 million tonnes worth of emissions credits will be awarded to regulated entities for emissions reduction activities undertaken between 1992 and 2006.&#160;&#160;These credits will be both tradable and bankable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Alberta
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Alberta enacted the
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Climate Change and Emissions Management Act
</FONT>
	(the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CCEMA
</FONT>
	") on July 1, 2007, amending it through the
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Climate Change and Emissions Management Amendment Act
</FONT>
	which
	received royal assent on November 4, 2008.&#160;&#160;The CCEMA is based on an emissions intensity approach similar to the Updated Action Plan and aims for a 50% reduction from 1990 emissions relative to GDP by 2020.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Alberta facilities emitting more than 100,000 tonnes of greenhouse gases a year are subject to&#160;the CCEMA.&#160;&#160;Similarly to the Updated Action Plan, the CCEMA and the associated
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Specified Gas Emitters Regulation
</FONT>
	make a distinction between "Existing Facilities" and "New
	Facilities".&#160;&#160;Existing Facilities are defined as facilities that completed their first year of commercial operation prior to January 1, 2008 or that have completed 8 or more years of commercial operation.&#160;&#160;Existing Facilities were required to reduce their emissions intensity by March 31, 2008 by 12% from a baseline established by their average emissions intensity between 2003 and 2005.&#160;&#160;New Facilities are defined as facilities that completed their first year of commercial operation
	subsequent to December 31, 2008, have completed less than 8 years of commercial operation, or are designated as New Facilities in accordance with the
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Specified Gas Emitters Regulation
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;New Facilities are also required to reduce their emissions intensity by 12% but this target is based on the emissions intensity of the facility in its third year of commercial operation and does not apply during the first 3 years of operation of the New Facility.&#160;&#160;Unlike
	the Updated Action Plan, the CCEMA does not contain any provision for continuous annual improvements beyond the 12% emissions intensity required.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The CCEMA contains similar compliance mechanisms as the Updated Action Plan.&#160;&#160;Regulated emitters can meet their emissions intensity targets by contributing to the Climate Change and Emissions Management Fund (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Fund
</FONT>
	") at a rate of $15 per tonne of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalent.&#160;&#160;Unlike
	the Updated Action Plan, the CCEMA contains no provisions for an increase to this contribution rate.&#160;&#160;Emissions credits can be purchased from regulated emitters that have reduced their emissions below the 100,000 tonne threshold or non-regulated emitters that have generated emissions offsets through activities that result in emissions reductions in accordance with established protocols published by the Government of Alberta.&#160;&#160;Unlike the Updated Action Plan, the CCEMA does not contemplate a
	linkage to external compliance mechanisms such as the Kyoto Protocol's Clean Development Mechanism.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	-&#160;82&#160;-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at year-end 2009, Baytex did not have an interest in any facilities in Alberta that emit more than 100,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
	equivalents per year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	British Columbia
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In February, 2008, British Columbia announced a revenue-neutral carbon tax that took effect July 1, 2008.&#160;&#160;The tax is consumption-based and applied at the time of retail sale or consumption of virtually all fossil fuels purchased or used in British Columbia.&#160;&#160;The initial level of the tax was set at $10
	per tonne of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalent and rose to $15 per tonne of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalent on July 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;It is scheduled to further increase at a rate of $5 per tonne of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalent on July 1 of every year until it reaches $30 per tonne of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalent
	on July 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;&#160;In order to make the tax revenue-neutral, British Columbia has implemented tax credits and reductions in order to offset the tax revenues that the Government of British Columbia would otherwise receive from the tax.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On April 3, 2008, British Columbia introduced the
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Greenhouse Gas Reduction (Cap and Trade) Act
</FONT>
	(the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Cap and Trade Act
</FONT>
	") which received royal assent on May 29, 2008 and will come into force by regulation of the
	Lieutenant Governor in Council.&#160;&#160;Unlike the emissions intensity approach taken by the federal government and the Government of Alberta, the Cap and Trade Act establishes an absolute cap on greenhouse gas emissions.&#160;&#160;It is expected that greenhouse gas emissions restrictions will be applied to facilities emitting more than 25,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalents per year, which will be required to meet established targets through
	a combination of emissions allowances issued by the Government of British Columbia and the purchase of emissions offsets generated through activities that result in a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.&#160;&#160;Although more specific details of British Columbia's cap and trade plan have not yet been finalized, on January 1, 2010, new reporting regulations came into force requiring all British Columbia facilities emitting over 10,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalents
	per year to begin reporting their emissions.&#160;&#160;Facilities reporting emissions greater than 25,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalents per year are required to have their emissions reports verified by a third party.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at year-end 2009, Baytex's Cache Creek facility emitted more than 10,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalents per year and, therefore, will be subject to reporting requirements under the Cap and Trade Act.&#160;&#160;As at year-end 2009, Baytex did not have
	an interest in any facilities in British Columbia that emit more than 25,000 tonnes of CO
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: SUB">
	2
</FONT>
	equivalents per year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Saskatchewan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On May 11, 2009, the Government of Saskatchewan announced
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	The Management and Reduction of Greenhouse Gases Act
</FONT>
	(the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MRGGA
</FONT>
	") to regulate greenhouse gas emissions in the province.&#160;&#160;Although the MRGGA has only passed
	first reading in the Saskatchewan legislature and the specific details of the legislation have not yet been determined, it is expected that the MRGGA will adopt the goal of a 20% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2020 and permit the use of technology fund contributions and emissions offsets in compliance, similar to both the federal and Alberta climate change initiatives.&#160;&#160;It remains unclear whether the scheme implemented by the MRGGA will be based on emissions intensity or an absolute cap on
	emissions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	United States
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Trust, through its subsidiary, Baytex Energy USA Ltd., also owns oil and natural gas properties and related assets in North Dakota and Wyoming in the United States.&#160;&#160;Baytex USA's oil and natural gas operations in the United States are regulated by administrative agencies under statutory provisions of the states where such
	operations are conducted and by certain agencies of the federal government for operations on federal leases.&#160;&#160;These statutory provisions regulate matters such as the exploration for and production of crude oil and natural gas, including provisions related to permits for the drilling of wells, bonding requirements in order to drill or operate wells, the location of wells, the method of drilling and casing wells, the surface use and restoration of properties upon which wells are drilled, and the abandonment
	of wells.&#160;&#160;Baytex USA's operations in the United States are also subject to various conservation laws and regulations which regulate matters such as the size of drilling and spacing units or proration units, the number of wells which may be drilled in an area, and the unitization or pooling of crude oil and natural gas properties.&#160;&#160;In addition, state conservation laws sometimes establish maximum rates of production from crude oil and natural gas wells, generally prohibit the venting or flaring
	of natural gas, and impose certain requirements regarding the rateability or fair apportionment of production from fields and individual wells.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	REPORT OF MANAGEMENT AND DIRECTORS ON OIL AND GAS DISCLOSURE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Form 51-101F3
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management of Baytex Energy Ltd. ("
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Baytex
</FONT>
	"), on behalf of Baytex Energy Trust (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Trust
</FONT>
	"), is responsible for the preparation and disclosure of information with respect to the Trust's oil and natural gas activities in accordance
	with securities regulatory requirements. This information includes reserves data, which are estimates of proved reserves and probable reserves and related future net revenue as at December&#160;31, 2009, estimated using forecast prices and costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An independent qualified reserves evaluator has evaluated the Trust's reserves data. The report of the independent qualified reserves evaluator is presented below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Reserves Committee of the Board of Directors of Baytex, on behalf of the Trust, has:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	reviewed the Trust's procedures for providing information to the independent qualified reserves evaluator;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	met with the independent qualified reserves evaluator to determine whether any restrictions affected the ability of the independent qualified reserves evaluator to report without reservation; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>

	reviewed the reserves data with management and the independent qualified reserves evaluator.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Reserves Committee of the Board of Directors of Baytex, on behalf of the Trust, has reviewed the Trust's procedures for assembling and reporting other information associated with oil and natural gas activities and has reviewed that information with management. The Board of Directors has, on the recommendation of the Reserves Committee,
	approved:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	John A. Brussa

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	APPENDIX B
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	REPORT ON RESERVES DATA BY INDEPENDENT QUALIFIED RESERVES EVALUATOR
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Form 51-101F2
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the Board of Directors of Baytex Energy Ltd. ("
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Baytex
</FONT>
	"), on behalf of Baytex Energy Trust (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Trust
</FONT>
	"):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. &#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have evaluated the Trust's reserves data as at December 31, 2009. The reserves data are estimates of proved reserves and probable reserves and related future net revenue as at December 31, 2009, estimated using forecast prices and costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The reserves data are the responsibility of Baytex's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the reserves data based on our evaluation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We carried out our evaluation in accordance with standards set out in the Canadian Oil and Gas Evaluation Handbook (the "
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	COGE Handbook
</FONT>
	") prepared jointly by the Society of Petroleum Evaluation Engineers (Calgary Chapter) and the Canadian Institute of Mining, Metallurgy&#160;&amp;
	Petroleum (Petroleum Society).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Those standards require that we plan and perform an evaluation to obtain reasonable assurance as to whether the reserves data are free of material misstatement. An evaluation also includes assessing whether the reserves data are in accordance with principles and definitions presented in the COGE Handbook.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table sets forth the estimated future net revenue (before deduction of income taxes) attributed to proved plus probable reserves, estimated using forecast prices and costs and calculated using a discount rate of 10 percent, included in the reserves data of the Trust evaluated by us for the year ended December 31, 2009, and identifies the
	respective portions thereof that we have audited, evaluated and reviewed and reported on to the management and Board of Directors of Baytex:
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="10%">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	$3,832.9
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="10%">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Nil
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="8%">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	$3,832.9
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In our opinion, the reserves data respectively evaluated by us have, in all material respects, been determined and are in accordance with the COGE Handbook.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	6.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have no responsibility to update the report referred to in paragraph 4 for events and circumstances occurring after its preparation date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

	7.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Because the reserves data are based on judgements regarding future events, actual results will vary and the variations may be material. However, any variation should be consistent with the fact that reserves are categorized according to the probability of their recovery.
</FONT>
</DIV>
